<s> frankenstein or the modern prometheus by mary wollstonecraft godwin shelley letter st </s>
<s> petersburgh dec </s>
<s> th to mrs saville england you will rejoice to hear that no disaster has accompanied the commencement of an enterprise which you have regarded with such evil forebodings </s>
<s> arrived here yesterday and my first task is to assure my dear sister of my welfare and increasing confidence in the success of my undertaking </s>
<s> am already far north of london and as walk in the streets of petersburgh feel cold northern breeze play upon my cheeks which braces my nerves and fills me with delight </s>
<s> do you understand this feeling </s>
<s> this breeze which has travelled from the regions towards which am advancing gives me foretaste of those icy climes </s>
<s> inspirited by this wind of promise my daydreams become more fervent and vivid </s>
<s> try in vain to be persuaded that the pole is the seat of frost and desolation it ever presents itself to my imagination as the region of beauty and delight </s>
<s> there margaret the sun is forever visible its broad disk just skirting the horizon and diffusing perpetual splendour </s>
<s> there for with your leave my sister will put some trust in preceding navigators there snow and frost are banished and sailing over calm sea we may be wafted to land surpassing in wonders and in beauty every region hitherto discovered on the habitable globe </s>
<s> its productions and features may be without example as the phenomena of the heavenly bodies undoubtedly are in those undiscovered solitudes </s>
<s> what may not be expected in country of eternal light </s>
<s> may there discover the wondrous power which attracts the needle and may regulate thousand celestial observations that require only this voyage to render their seeming eccentricities consistent forever </s>
<s> shall satiate my ardent curiosity with the sight of part of the world never before visited and may tread land never before imprinted by the foot of man </s>
<s> these are my enticements and they are sufficient to conquer all fear of danger or death and to induce me to commence this laborious voyage with the joy child feels when he embarks in little boat with his holiday mates on an expedition of discovery up his native river </s>
<s> but supposing all these conjectures to be false you cannot contest the inestimable benefit which shall confer on all mankind to the last generation by discovering passage near the pole to those countries to reach which at present so many months are requisite or by ascertaining the secret of the magnet which if at all possible can only be effected by an undertaking such as mine </s>
<s> these reflections have dispelled the agitation with which began my letter and feel my heart glow with an enthusiasm which elevates me to heaven for nothing contributes so much to tranquillize the mind as steady purpose point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye </s>
<s> this expedition has been the favourite dream of my early years </s>
<s> have read with ardour the accounts of the various voyages which have been made in the prospect of arriving at the north pacific ocean through the seas which surround the pole </s>
<s> you may remember that history of all the voyages made for purposes of discovery composed the whole of our good uncle thomas library </s>
<s> my education was neglected yet was passionately fond of reading </s>
<s> these volumes were my study day and night and my familiarity with them increased that regret which had felt as child on learning that my father's dying injunction had forbidden my uncle to allow me to embark in seafaring life </s>
<s> these visions faded when perused for the first time those poets whose effusions entranced my soul and lifted it to heaven </s>
<s> also became poet and for one year lived in paradise of my own creation imagined that also might obtain niche in the temple where the names of homer and shakespeare are consecrated </s>
<s> you are well acquainted with my failure and how heavily bore the disappointment </s>
<s> but just at that time inherited the fortune of my cousin and my thoughts were turned into the channel of their earlier bent </s>
<s> six years have passed since resolved on my present undertaking </s>
<s> can even now remember the hour from which dedicated myself to this great enterprise </s>
<s> commenced by inuring my body to hardship </s>
<s> accompanied the whale fishers on several expeditions to the north sea voluntarily endured cold famine thirst and want of sleep often worked harder than the common sailors during the day and devoted my nights to the study of mathematics the theory of medicine and those branches of physical science from which naval adventurer might derive the greatest practical advantage </s>
<s> twice actually hired myself as an under mate in greenland whaler and acquitted myself to admiration </s>
<s> must own felt little proud when my captain offered me the second dignity in the vessel and entreated me to remain with the greatest earnestness so valuable did he consider my services </s>
<s> and now dear margaret do not deserve to accomplish some great purpose </s>
<s> my life might have been passed in ease and luxury but preferred glory to every enticement that wealth placed in my path </s>
<s> oh that some encouraging voice would answer in the affirmative </s>
<s> my courage and my resolution is firm but my hopes fluctuate and my spirits are often depressed </s>
<s> am about to proceed on long and difficult voyage the emergencies of which will demand all my fortitude am required not only to raise the spirits of others but sometimes to sustain my own when theirs are failing </s>
<s> this is the most favourable period for travelling in russia </s>
<s> they fly quickly over the snow in their sledges the motion is pleasant and in my opinion far more agreeable than that of an english stagecoach </s>
<s> the cold is not excessive if you are wrapped in furs dress which have already adopted for there is great difference between walking the deck and remaining seated motionless for hours when no exercise prevents the blood from actually freezing in your veins </s>
<s> have no ambition to lose my life on the post road between st </s>
<s> petersburgh and archangel </s>
<s> shall depart for the latter town in fortnight or three weeks and my intention is to hire ship there which can easily be done by paying the insurance for the owner and to engage as many sailors as think necessary among those who are accustomed to the whale fishing </s>
<s> do not intend to sail until the month of june and when shall return </s>
<s> ah dear sister how can answer this question </s>
<s> if succeed many many months perhaps years will pass before you and may meet </s>
<s> if fail you will see me again soon or never </s>
<s> farewell my dear excellent margaret </s>
<s> heaven shower down blessings on you and save me that may again and again testify my gratitude for all your love and kindness </s>
<s> your affectionate brother </s>
<s> walton letter archangel th march to mrs saville england how slowly the time passes here encompassed as am by frost and snow </s>
<s> yet second step is taken towards my enterprise </s>
<s> have hired vessel and am occupied in collecting my sailors those whom have already engaged appear to be men on whom can depend and are certainly possessed of dauntless courage </s>
<s> but have one want which have never yet been able to satisfy and the absence of the object of which now feel as most severe evil have no friend margaret when am glowing with the enthusiasm of success there will be none to participate my joy if am assailed by disappointment no one will endeavour to sustain me in dejection </s>
<s> shall commit my thoughts to paper it is true but that is poor medium for the communication of feeling </s>
<s> desire the company of man who could sympathize with me whose eyes would reply to mine </s>
<s> you may deem me romantic my dear sister but bitterly feel the want of friend </s>
<s> have no one near me gentle yet courageous possessed of cultivated as well as of capacious mind whose tastes are like my own to approve or amend my plans </s>
<s> how would such friend repair the faults of your poor brother </s>
<s> am too ardent in execution and too impatient of difficulties </s>
<s> but it is still greater evil to me that am self educated for the first fourteen years of my life ran wild on common and read nothing but our uncle thomas books of voyages </s>
<s> at that age became acquainted with the celebrated poets of our own country but it was only when it had ceased to be in my power to derive its most important benefits from such conviction that perceived the necessity of becoming acquainted with more languages than that of my native country </s>
<s> now am twenty eight and am in reality more illiterate than many schoolboys of fifteen </s>
<s> it is true that have thought more and that my daydreams are more extended and magnificent but they want as the painters call it keeping and greatly need friend who would have sense enough not to despise me as romantic and affection enough for me to endeavour to regulate my mind </s>
<s> well these are useless complaints shall certainly find no friend on the wide ocean nor even here in archangel among merchants and seamen </s>
<s> yet some feelings unallied to the dross of human nature beat even in these rugged bosoms </s>
<s> my lieutenant for instance is man of wonderful courage and enterprise he is madly desirous of glory or rather to word my phrase more characteristically of advancement in his profession </s>
<s> he is an englishman and in the midst of national and professional prejudices unsoftened by cultivation retains some of the noblest endowments of humanity </s>
<s> first became acquainted with him on board whale vessel finding that he was unemployed in this city easily engaged him to assist in my enterprise </s>
<s> the master is person of an excellent disposition and is remarkable in the ship for his gentleness and the mildness of his discipline </s>
<s> this circumstance added to his well known integrity and dauntless courage made me very desirous to engage him </s>
<s> youth passed in solitude my best years spent under your gentle and feminine fosterage has so refined the groundwork of my character that cannot overcome an intense distaste to the usual brutality exercised on board ship have never believed it to be necessary and when heard of mariner equally noted for his kindliness of heart and the respect and obedience paid to him by his crew felt myself peculiarly fortunate in being able to secure his services </s>
<s> heard of him first in rather romantic manner from lady who owes to him the happiness of her life </s>
<s> this briefly is his story </s>
<s> some years ago he loved young russian lady of moderate fortune and having amassed considerable sum in prize money the father of the girl consented to the match </s>
<s> he saw his mistress once before the destined ceremony but she was bathed in tears and throwing herself at his feet entreated him to spare her confessing at the same time that she loved another but that he was poor and that her father would never consent to the union </s>
<s> my generous friend reassured the suppliant and on being informed of the name of her lover instantly abandoned his pursuit </s>
<s> he had already bought farm with his money on which he had designed to pass the remainder of his life but he bestowed the whole on his rival together with the remains of his prize money to purchase stock and then himself solicited the young woman's father to consent to her marriage with her lover </s>
<s> but the old man decidedly refused thinking himself bound in honour to my friend who when he found the father inexorable quitted his country nor returned until he heard that his former mistress was married according to her inclinations </s>
<s> what noble fellow you will exclaim </s>
<s> he is so but then he is wholly uneducated he is as silent as turk and kind of ignorant carelessness attends him which while it renders his conduct the more astonishing detracts from the interest and sympathy which otherwise he would command </s>
<s> yet do not suppose because complain little or because can conceive consolation for my toils which may never know that am wavering in my resolutions </s>
<s> those are as fixed as fate and my voyage is only now delayed until the weather shall permit my embarkation </s>
<s> the winter has been dreadfully severe but the spring promises well and it is considered as remarkably early season so that perhaps may sail sooner than expected </s>
<s> shall do nothing rashly you know me sufficiently to confide in my prudence and considerateness whenever the safety of others is committed to my care </s>
<s> cannot describe to you my sensations on the near prospect of my undertaking </s>
<s> it is impossible to communicate to you conception of the trembling sensation half pleasurable and half fearful with which am preparing to depart </s>
<s> am going to unexplored regions to the land of mist and snow but shall kill no albatross therefore do not be alarmed for my safety or if should come back to you as worn and woeful as the ancient mariner you will smile at my allusion but will disclose secret </s>
<s> have often attributed my attachment to my passionate enthusiasm for the dangerous mysteries of ocean to that production of the most imaginative of modern poets </s>
<s> there is something at work in my soul which do not understand </s>
<s> am practically industrious painstaking workman to execute with perseverance and labour but besides this there is love for the marvellous belief in the marvellous intertwined in all my projects which hurries me out of the common pathways of men even to the wild sea and unvisited regions am about to explore </s>
<s> but to return to dearer considerations </s>
<s> shall meet you again after having traversed immense seas and returned by the most southern cape of africa or america </s>
<s> dare not expect such success yet cannot bear to look on the reverse of the picture </s>
<s> continue for the present to write to me by every opportunity may receive your letters on some occasions when need them most to support my spirits </s>
<s> love you very tenderly </s>
<s> remember me with affection should you never hear from me again </s>
<s> your affectionate brother robert walton letter july th to mrs saville england my dear sister write few lines in haste to say that am safe and well advanced on my voyage </s>
<s> this letter will reach england by merchantman now on its homeward voyage from archangel more fortunate than who may not see my native land perhaps for many years </s>
<s> am however in good spirits my men are bold and apparently firm of purpose nor do the floating sheets of ice that continually pass us indicating the dangers of the region towards which we are advancing appear to dismay them </s>
<s> we have already reached very high latitude but it is the height of summer and although not so warm as in england the southern gales which blow us speedily towards those shores which so ardently desire to attain breathe degree of renovating warmth which had not expected </s>
<s> no incidents have hitherto befallen us that would make figure in letter </s>
<s> one or two stiff gales and the springing of leak are accidents which experienced navigators scarcely remember to record and shall be well content if nothing worse happen to us during our voyage </s>
<s> adieu my dear margaret </s>
<s> be assured that for my own sake as well as yours will not rashly encounter danger </s>
<s> will be cool persevering and prudent </s>
<s> but success shall crown my endeavours </s>
<s> wherefore not </s>
<s> thus far have gone tracing secure way over the pathless seas the very stars themselves being witnesses and testimonies of my triumph </s>
<s> why not still proceed over the untamed yet obedient element </s>
<s> what can stop the determined heart and resolved will of man </s>
<s> my swelling heart involuntarily pours itself out thus </s>
<s> but must finish </s>
<s> heaven bless my beloved sister </s>

<s> letter august th to mrs saville england so strange an accident has happened to us that cannot forbear recording it although it is very probable that you will see me before these papers can come into your possession </s>
<s> last monday july st we were nearly surrounded by ice which closed in the ship on all sides scarcely leaving her the sea room in which she floated </s>
<s> our situation was somewhat dangerous especially as we were compassed round by very thick fog </s>
<s> we accordingly lay to hoping that some change would take place in the atmosphere and weather </s>
<s> about two o'clock the mist cleared away and we beheld stretched out in every direction vast and irregular plains of ice which seemed to have no end </s>
<s> some of my comrades groaned and my own mind began to grow watchful with anxious thoughts when strange sight suddenly attracted our attention and diverted our solicitude from our own situation </s>
<s> we perceived low carriage fixed on sledge and drawn by dogs pass on towards the north at the distance of half mile being which had the shape of man but apparently of gigantic stature sat in the sledge and guided the dogs </s>
<s> we watched the rapid progress of the traveller with our telescopes until he was lost among the distant inequalities of the ice </s>
<s> this appearance excited our unqualified wonder </s>
<s> we were as we believed many hundred miles from any land but this apparition seemed to denote that it was not in reality so distant as we had supposed </s>
<s> shut in however by ice it was impossible to follow his track which we had observed with the greatest attention </s>
<s> about two hours after this occurrence we heard the ground sea and before night the ice broke and freed our ship </s>
<s> we however lay to until the morning fearing to encounter in the dark those large loose masses which float about after the breaking up of the ice </s>
<s> profited of this time to rest for few hours </s>
<s> in the morning however as soon as it was light went upon deck and found all the sailors busy on one side of the vessel apparently talking to someone in the sea </s>
<s> it was in fact sledge like that we had seen before which had drifted towards us in the night on large fragment of ice </s>
<s> only one dog remained alive but there was human being within it whom the sailors were persuading to enter the vessel </s>
<s> he was not as the other traveller seemed to be savage inhabitant of some undiscovered island but european </s>
<s> when appeared on deck the master said here is our captain and he will not allow you to perish on the open sea on perceiving me the stranger addressed me in english although with foreign accent </s>
<s> before come on board your vessel said he will you have the kindness to inform me whither you are bound you may conceive my astonishment on hearing such question addressed to me from man on the brink of destruction and to whom should have supposed that my vessel would have been resource which he would not have exchanged for the most precious wealth the earth can afford </s>
<s> replied however that we were on voyage of discovery towards the northern pole </s>
<s> upon hearing this he appeared satisfied and consented to come on board </s>
<s> good god </s>
<s> margaret if you had seen the man who thus capitulated for his safety your surprise would have been boundless </s>
<s> his limbs were nearly frozen and his body dreadfully emaciated by fatigue and suffering </s>
<s> never saw man in so wretched condition </s>
<s> we attempted to carry him into the cabin but as soon as he had quitted the fresh air he fainted </s>
<s> we accordingly brought him back to the deck and restored him to animation by rubbing him with brandy and forcing him to swallow small quantity </s>
<s> as soon as he showed signs of life we wrapped him up in blankets and placed him near the chimney of the kitchen stove </s>
<s> by slow degrees he recovered and ate little soup which restored him wonderfully </s>
<s> two days passed in this manner before he was able to speak and often feared that his sufferings had deprived him of understanding </s>
<s> when he had in some measure recovered removed him to my own cabin and attended on him as much as my duty would permit </s>
<s> never saw more interesting creature his eyes have generally an expression of wildness and even madness but there are moments when if anyone performs an act of kindness towards him or does him any the most trifling service his whole countenance is lighted up as it were with beam of benevolence and sweetness that never saw equalled </s>
<s> but he is generally melancholy and despairing and sometimes he gnashes his teeth as if impatient of the weight of woes that oppresses him </s>
<s> when my guest was little recovered had great trouble to keep off the men who wished to ask him thousand questions but would not allow him to be tormented by their idle curiosity in state of body and mind whose restoration evidently depended upon entire repose </s>
<s> once however the lieutenant asked why he had come so far upon the ice in so strange vehicle </s>
<s> his countenance instantly assumed an aspect of the deepest gloom and he replied to seek one who fled from me and did the man whom you pursued travel in the same fashion yes then fancy we have seen him for the day before we picked you up we saw some dogs drawing sledge with man in it across the ice this aroused the stranger's attention and he asked multitude of questions concerning the route which the demon as he called him had pursued </s>
<s> soon after when he was alone with me he said have doubtless excited your curiosity as well as that of these good people but you are too considerate to make inquiries certainly it would indeed be very impertinent and inhuman in me to trouble you with any inquisitiveness of mine and yet you rescued me from strange and perilous situation you have benevolently restored me to life soon after this he inquired if thought that the breaking up of the ice had destroyed the other sledge </s>
<s> replied that could not answer with any degree of certainty for the ice had not broken until near midnight and the traveller might have arrived at place of safety before that time but of this could not judge </s>
<s> from this time new spirit of life animated the decaying frame of the stranger </s>
<s> he manifested the greatest eagerness to be upon deck to watch for the sledge which had before appeared but have persuaded him to remain in the cabin for he is far too weak to sustain the rawness of the atmosphere </s>
<s> have promised that someone should watch for him and give him instant notice if any new object should appear in sight </s>
<s> such is my journal of what relates to this strange occurrence up to the present day </s>
<s> the stranger has gradually improved in health but is very silent and appears uneasy when anyone except myself enters his cabin </s>
<s> yet his manners are so conciliating and gentle that the sailors are all interested in him although they have had very little communication with him </s>
<s> for my own part begin to love him as brother and his constant and deep grief fills me with sympathy and compassion </s>
<s> he must have been noble creature in his better days being even now in wreck so attractive and amiable </s>
<s> said in one of my letters my dear margaret that should find no friend on the wide ocean yet have found man who before his spirit had been broken by misery should have been happy to have possessed as the brother of my heart </s>
<s> shall continue my journal concerning the stranger at intervals should have any fresh incidents to record </s>
<s> august th my affection for my guest increases every day </s>
<s> he excites at once my admiration and my pity to an astonishing degree </s>
<s> how can see so noble creature destroyed by misery without feeling the most poignant grief </s>
<s> he is so gentle yet so wise his mind is so cultivated and when he speaks although his words are culled with the choicest art yet they flow with rapidity and unparalleled eloquence </s>
<s> he is now much recovered from his illness and is continually on the deck apparently watching for the sledge that preceded his own </s>
<s> yet although unhappy he is not so utterly occupied by his own misery but that he interests himself deeply in the projects of others </s>
<s> he has frequently conversed with me on mine which have communicated to him without disguise </s>
<s> he entered attentively into all my arguments in favour of my eventual success and into every minute detail of the measures had taken to secure it </s>
<s> was easily led by the sympathy which he evinced to use the language of my heart to give utterance to the burning ardour of my soul and to say with all the fervour that warmed me how gladly would sacrifice my fortune my existence my every hope to the furtherance of my enterprise </s>
<s> one man's life or death were but small price to pay for the acquirement of the knowledge which sought for the dominion should acquire and transmit over the elemental foes of our race </s>
<s> as spoke dark gloom spread over my listener's countenance </s>
<s> at first perceived that he tried to suppress his emotion he placed his hands before his eyes and my voice quivered and failed me as beheld tears trickle fast from between his fingers groan burst from his heaving breast </s>
<s> paused at length he spoke in broken accents unhappy man </s>
<s> do you share my madness </s>
<s> have you drunk also of the intoxicating draught </s>
<s> hear me let me reveal my tale and you will dash the cup from your lips such words you may imagine strongly excited my curiosity but the paroxysm of grief that had seized the stranger overcame his weakened powers and many hours of repose and tranquil conversation were necessary to restore his composure </s>
<s> having conquered the violence of his feelings he appeared to despise himself for being the slave of passion and quelling the dark tyranny of despair he led me again to converse concerning myself personally </s>
<s> he asked me the history of my earlier years </s>
<s> the tale was quickly told but it awakened various trains of reflection </s>
<s> spoke of my desire of finding friend of my thirst for more intimate sympathy with fellow mind than had ever fallen to my lot and expressed my conviction that man could boast of little happiness who did not enjoy this blessing </s>
<s> agree with you replied the stranger we are unfashioned creatures but half made up if one wiser better dearer than ourselves such friend ought to be do not lend his aid to perfectionate our weak and faulty natures </s>
<s> once had friend the most noble of human creatures and am entitled therefore to judge respecting friendship </s>
<s> you have hope and the world before you and have no cause for despair </s>
<s> but have lost everything and cannot begin life anew as he said this his countenance became expressive of calm settled grief that touched me to the heart </s>
<s> but he was silent and presently retired to his cabin </s>
<s> even broken in spirit as he is no one can feel more deeply than he does the beauties of nature </s>
<s> the starry sky the sea and every sight afforded by these wonderful regions seem still to have the power of elevating his soul from earth </s>
<s> such man has double existence he may suffer misery and be overwhelmed by disappointments yet when he has retired into himself he will be like celestial spirit that has halo around him within whose circle no grief or folly ventures </s>
<s> will you smile at the enthusiasm express concerning this divine wanderer </s>
<s> you would not if you saw him </s>
<s> you have been tutored and refined by books and retirement from the world and you are therefore somewhat fastidious but this only renders you the more fit to appreciate the extraordinary merits of this wonderful man </s>
<s> sometimes have endeavoured to discover what quality it is which he possesses that elevates him so immeasurably above any other person ever knew </s>
<s> believe it to be an intuitive discernment quick but never failing power of judgment penetration into the causes of things unequalled for clearness and precision add to this facility of expression and voice whose varied intonations are soul subduing music </s>
<s> august yesterday the stranger said to me you may easily perceive captain walton that have suffered great and unparalleled misfortunes </s>
<s> had determined at one time that the memory of these evils should die with me but you have won me to alter my determination </s>
<s> you seek for knowledge and wisdom as once did and ardently hope that the gratification of your wishes may not be serpent to sting you as mine has been </s>
<s> do not know that the relation of my disasters will be useful to you yet when reflect that you are pursuing the same course exposing yourself to the same dangers which have rendered me what am imagine that you may deduce an apt moral from my tale one that may direct you if you succeed in your undertaking and console you in case of failure </s>
<s> prepare to hear of occurrences which are usually deemed marvellous </s>
<s> were we among the tamer scenes of nature might fear to encounter your unbelief perhaps your ridicule but many things will appear possible in these wild and mysterious regions which would provoke the laughter of those unacquainted with the ever varied powers of nature nor can doubt but that my tale conveys in its series internal evidence of the truth of the events of which it is composed you may easily imagine that was much gratified by the offered communication yet could not endure that he should renew his grief by recital of his misfortunes </s>
<s> felt the greatest eagerness to hear the promised narrative partly from curiosity and partly from strong desire to ameliorate his fate if it were in my power </s>
<s> expressed these feelings in my answer </s>
<s> thank you he replied for your sympathy but it is useless my fate is nearly fulfilled </s>
<s> wait but for one event and then shall repose in peace </s>
<s> understand your feeling continued he perceiving that wished to interrupt him but you are mistaken my friend if thus you will allow me to name you nothing can alter my destiny listen to my history and you will perceive how irrevocably it is determined he then told me that he would commence his narrative the next day when should be at leisure </s>
<s> this promise drew from me the warmest thanks </s>
<s> have resolved every night when am not imperatively occupied by my duties to record as nearly as possible in his own words what he has related during the day </s>
<s> if should be engaged will at least make notes </s>
<s> this manuscript will doubtless afford you the greatest pleasure but to me who know him and who hear it from his own lips with what interest and sympathy shall read it in some future day </s>
<s> even now as commence my task his full toned voice swells in my ears his lustrous eyes dwell on me with all their melancholy sweetness see his thin hand raised in animation while the lineaments of his face are irradiated by the soul within </s>
<s> strange and harrowing must be his story frightful the storm which embraced the gallant vessel on its course and wrecked it thus </s>
<s> chapter am by birth genevese and my family is one of the most distinguished of that republic </s>
<s> my ancestors had been for many years counsellors and syndics and my father had filled several public situations with honour and reputation </s>
<s> he was respected by all who knew him for his integrity and indefatigable attention to public business </s>
<s> he passed his younger days perpetually occupied by the affairs of his country variety of circumstances had prevented his marrying early nor was it until the decline of life that he became husband and the father of family </s>
<s> as the circumstances of his marriage illustrate his character cannot refrain from relating them </s>
<s> one of his most intimate friends was merchant who from flourishing state fell through numerous mischances into poverty </s>
<s> this man whose name was beaufort was of proud and unbending disposition and could not bear to live in poverty and oblivion in the same country where he had formerly been distinguished for his rank and magnificence </s>
<s> having paid his debts therefore in the most honourable manner he retreated with his daughter to the town of lucerne where he lived unknown and in wretchedness </s>
<s> my father loved beaufort with the truest friendship and was deeply grieved by his retreat in these unfortunate circumstances </s>
<s> he bitterly deplored the false pride which led his friend to conduct so little worthy of the affection that united them </s>
<s> he lost no time in endeavouring to seek him out with the hope of persuading him to begin the world again through his credit and assistance </s>
<s> beaufort had taken effectual measures to conceal himself and it was ten months before my father discovered his abode </s>
<s> overjoyed at this discovery he hastened to the house which was situated in mean street near the reuss </s>
<s> but when he entered misery and despair alone welcomed him </s>
<s> beaufort had saved but very small sum of money from the wreck of his fortunes but it was sufficient to provide him with sustenance for some months and in the meantime he hoped to procure some respectable employment in merchant's house </s>
<s> the interval was consequently spent in inaction his grief only became more deep and rankling when he had leisure for reflection and at length it took so fast hold of his mind that at the end of three months he lay on bed of sickness incapable of any exertion </s>
<s> his daughter attended him with the greatest tenderness but she saw with despair that their little fund was rapidly decreasing and that there was no other prospect of support </s>
<s> but caroline beaufort possessed mind of an uncommon mould and her courage rose to support her in her adversity </s>
<s> she procured plain work she plaited straw and by various means contrived to earn pittance scarcely sufficient to support life </s>
<s> several months passed in this manner </s>
<s> her father grew worse her time was more entirely occupied in attending him her means of subsistence decreased and in the tenth month her father died in her arms leaving her an orphan and beggar </s>
<s> this last blow overcame her and she knelt by beaufort's coffin weeping bitterly when my father entered the chamber </s>

<s> not because the way was smooth and placid as southern sea but because it was full of dangers and terror because at every new incident your fortitude was to be called forth and your courage exhibited because danger and death surrounded it and these you were to brave and overcome </s>
<s> for this was it glorious for this was it an honourable undertaking </s>
<s> you were hereafter to be hailed as the benefactors of your species your names adored as belonging to brave men who encountered death for honour and the benefit of mankind </s>

<s> be men or be more than men </s>

<s> we were in the most imminent peril but as we could only remain passive my chief attention was occupied by my unfortunate guest whose illness increased in such degree that he was entirely confined to his bed </s>

<s> it was long before he was restored and often thought that life was entirely extinct </s>

<s> the strength relied on is gone feel that shall soon die and he my enemy and persecutor may still be in being </s>
<s> think not walton that in the last moments of my existence feel that burning hatred and ardent desire of revenge once expressed but feel myself justified in desiring the death of my adversary </s>
<s> during these last days have been occupied in examining my past conduct nor do find it blamable </s>
<s> in fit of enthusiastic madness created rational creature and was bound towards him to assure as far as was in my power his happiness and well being </s>
<s> this was my duty but there was another still paramount to that </s>
<s> my duties towards the beings of my own species had greater claims to my attention because they included greater proportion of happiness or misery </s>
<s> urged by this view refused and did right in refusing to create companion for the first creature </s>
<s> he showed unparalleled malignity and selfishness in evil he destroyed my friends he devoted to destruction beings who possessed exquisite sensations happiness and wisdom nor do know where this thirst for vengeance may end </s>
<s> miserable himself that he may render no other wretched he ought to die </s>

<s> there he lies white and cold in death </s>

<s> look on the hands which executed the deed think on the heart in which the imagination of it was conceived and long for the moment when these hands will meet my eyes when that imagination will haunt my thoughts no more </s>
<s> fear not that shall be the instrument of future mischief </s>
<s> my work is nearly complete </s>

<s> do not think that shall be slow to perform this sacrifice </s>

<s> mathilda by mary wollstonecraft shelley edited by elizabeth nitchie the university of north carolina press chapel hill mathilda is being published in paper as extra series of studies in philology </s>
<s> preface this volume prints for the first time the full text of mary shelley's novelette mathilda together with the opening pages of its rough draft the fields of fancy </s>
<s> they are transcribed from the microfilm of the notebooks belonging to lord abinger which is in the library of duke university </s>
<s> the text follows mary shelley's manuscript exactly except for the omission of mere corrections by the author most of which are negligible those that are significant are included and explained in the notes </s>
<s> footnotes indicated by an asterisk are mrs shelley's own notes </s>
<s> she was in general fairly good speller but certain words especially those in which there was question of doubling or not doubling letter gave her trouble untill though occasionally she deleted the final or wrote the word correctly agreable occured confering buble meaness receeded as well as hopless lonly seperate extactic sacrifise desart and words ending in ance or ence </s>
<s> these and other mispellings even those of proper names are reproduced without change or comment </s>
<s> the use of sic and of square brackets is reserved to indicate evident slips of the pen obviously incorrect unclear or incomplete phrasing and punctuation and my conjectures in emending them </s>
<s> am very grateful to the library of duke university and to its librarian dr </s>

<s> mary shelley author of frankenstein new brunswick rutgers university press nitchie mary shelley elizabeth nitchie may contents page preface iii introduction vii mathilda notes to mathilda the fields of fancy notes to the fields of fancy introduction of all the novels and stories which mary wollstonecraft shelley left in manuscript only one novelette mathilda is complete </s>
<s> it exists in both rough draft and final copy </s>
<s> in this story as in all mary shelley's writing there is much that is autobiographical it would be hard to find more self revealing work </s>
<s> for an understanding of mary's character especially as she saw herself and of her attitude toward shelley and toward godwin in this tale is an important document </s>
<s> although the main narrative that of the father's incestuous love for his daughter his suicide and mathilda's consequent withdrawal from society to lonely heath is not in any real sense autobiographical many elements in it are drawn from reality </s>
<s> the three main characters are clearly mary herself godwin and shelley and their relations can easily be reassorted to correspond with actuality </s>
<s> highly personal as the story was mary shelley hoped that it would be published evidently believing that the characters and the situations were sufficiently disguised </s>
<s> in may of she sent it to england by her friends the gisbornes with request that her father would arrange for its publication </s>
<s> but mathilda together with its rough draft entitled the fields of fancy remained unpublished among the shelley papers </s>
<s> although mary's references to it in her letters and journal aroused some curiosity among scholars it also remained unexamined until comparatively recently </s>
<s> this seeming neglect was due partly to the circumstances attending the distribution of the family papers after the deaths of sir percy and lady shelley </s>
<s> one part of them went to the bodleian library to become reserved collection which by the terms of lady shelley's will was opened to scholars only under definite restrictions </s>
<s> another part went to lady shelley's niece and in turn to her heirs who for time did not make the manuscripts available for study </s>
<s> third part went to sir john shelley rolls the poet's grand nephew who released much important shelley material but not all the scattered manuscripts </s>
<s> in this division the two notebooks containing the finished draft of mathilda and portion of the fields of fancy went to lord abinger the notebook containing the remainder of the rough draft to the bodleian library and some loose sheets containing additions and revisions to sir john shelley rolls </s>
<s> happily all the manuscripts are now accessible to scholars and it is possible to publish the full text of mathilda with such additions from the fields of fancy as are significant ii the three notebooks are alike in format iii one of lord abinger's notebooks contains the first part of the fields of fancy chapter through the beginning of chapter pages </s>
<s> the concluding portion occupies the first fifty four pages of the bodleian notebook </s>
<s> there is then blank page followed by three and half pages scored out of what seems to be variant of the end of chapter and the beginning of chapter </s>
<s> revised and expanded version of the first part of mathilda's narrative follows chapter and the beginning of chapter with break between the account of her girlhood in scotland and the brief description of her father after his return </s>
<s> finally there are four pages of new opening which was used in mathilda </s>
<s> this is an extremely rough draft punctuation is largely confined to the dash and there are many corrections and alterations </s>
<s> the shelley rolls fragments twenty five sheets or slips of paper usually represent additions to or revisions of the fields of fancy many of them are numbered and some are keyed into the manuscript in lord abinger's notebook </s>
<s> most of the changes were incorporated in mathilda </s>
<s> the second abinger notebook contains the complete and final draft of mathilda pages </s>
<s> it is for the most part fair copy </s>
<s> the text is punctuated and there are relatively few corrections most of them apparently the result of final rereading made to avoid the repetition of words </s>
<s> few additions are written in the margins </s>
<s> on several pages slips of paper containing evident revisions quite possibly originally among the shelley rolls fragments have been pasted over the corresponding lines of the text </s>
<s> an occasional passage is scored out and some words and phrases are crossed out to make way for revision </s>
<s> following page four sheets containing the conclusion of the story are cut out of the notebook </s>
<s> they appear the pages numbered to among the shelley rolls fragments </s>
<s> revised version pages to follows the cut iv the mode of telling the story in the final draft differs radically from that in the rough draft </s>
<s> in the fields of fancy mathilda's history is set in fanciful framework </s>
<s> the author is transported by the fairy fantasia to the elysian fields where she listens to the discourse of diotima and meets mathilda </s>
<s> mathilda tells her story which closes with her death </s>
<s> in the final draft this unrealistic and largely irrelevant framework is discarded mathilda whose death is approaching writes out for her friend woodville the full details of her tragic history which she had never had the courage to tell him in person </s>
<s> the title of the rough draft the fields of fancy and the setting and framework undoubtedly stem from mary wollstonecraft's unfinished tale the cave of fancy in which one of the souls confined in the center of the earth to purify themselves from the dross of their earthly existence tells to sagesta who may be compared with diotima the story of her ill fated love for man whom she hopes to rejoin after her purgation is completed mary was completely familiar with her mother's works </s>
<s> this title was of course abandoned when the framework was abandoned and the name of the heroine was substituted </s>
<s> though it is worth noticing that mary chose name with the same initial letter as her own it was probably taken from dante </s>
<s> there are several references in the story to the cantos of the purgatorio in which mathilda appears </s>
<s> mathilda's father is never named nor is mathilda's surname given </s>
<s> the name of the poet went through several changes welford lovel herbert and finally woodville </s>
<s> the evidence for dating mathilda in the late summer and autumn of comes partly from the manuscript partly from mary's journal </s>
<s> on the pages succeeding the portions of the fields of fancy in the bodleian notebook are some of shelley's drafts of verse and prose including parts of prometheus unbound and of epipsychidion both in italian and of the preface to the latter in english some prose fragments and extended portions of the defence of poetry </s>
<s> written from the other end of the book are the ode to naples and the witch of atlas </s>
<s> since these all belong to the years and it is probable that mary finished her rough draft some time in and that when she had copied her story shelley took over the notebook </s>
<s> chapter of mathilda in lord abinger's notebook is headed florence nov </s>
<s> th </s>
<s> since the whole of mathilda's story takes place in england and scotland the date must be that of the manuscript </s>
<s> mary was in florence at that time </s>
<s> these dates are supported by entries in mary's journal which indicate that she began writing mathilda early in august while the shelleys were living in the villa valosano near leghorn </s>
<s> on august after gap of two months from the time of her little son's death she resumed her diary </s>
<s> almost every day thereafter for month she recorded write and by september she was saying copy on september she wrote finish copying my tale the next entry to indicate literary activity is the one word write on november </s>
<s> on the th percy florence was born and mary did no more writing until march when she was working on valperga </s>
<s> it is probable therefore that mary wrote and copied mathilda between august and september that she did some revision on november and finally dated the manuscript november </s>
<s> the subsequent history of the manuscript is recorded in letters and journals </s>
<s> when the gisbornes went to england on may they took mathilda with them they read it on the journey and recorded their admiration of it in their journal vi they were to show it to godwin and get his advice about publishing it </s>
<s> although medwin heard about the story when he was with the shelleys in vii and mary read it perhaps from the rough draft to edward and jane williams in the summer of viii this manuscript apparently stayed in godwin's hands </s>
<s> he evidently did not share the gisbornes enthusiasm his approval was qualified </s>
<s> he thought highly of certain parts of it less highly of others and he regarded the subject as disgusting and detestable saying that the story would need preface to prevent readers from being tormented by the apprehension </s>
<s> of the fall of the heroine that is if it was ever published ix there is however no record of his having made any attempt to get it into print </s>
<s> from january through june mary repeatedly asked mrs gisborne to retrieve the manuscript and have it copied for her and mrs gisborne invariably reported her failure to do so </s>
<s> the last references to the story are after shelley's death in an unpublished journal entry and two of mary's letters </s>
<s> in her journal for october she told of the solace for her misery she had once found in writing mathilda </s>
<s> in one letter to mrs gisborne she compared the journey of herself and jane to pisa and leghorn to get news of shelley and williams to that of mathilda in search of her father driving like matilda towards the sea to learn if we were to be for ever doomed to misery and on may she wrote matilda foretells even many small circumstances most truly and the whole of it is monument of what now is xi these facts not only date the manuscript but also show mary's feeling of personal involvement in the story </s>
<s> in the events of it is possible to find the basis for this morbid tale and consequently to assess its biographical significance </s>
<s> on september the shelleys daughter clara everina barely year old died at venice </s>
<s> mary and her children had gone from bagni di lucca to este to join shelley at byron's villa </s>
<s> clara was not well when they started and she grew worse on the journey </s>
<s> from este shelley and mary took her to venice to consult physician trip which was beset with delays and difficulties </s>
<s> she died almost as soon as they arrived </s>
<s> according to newman ivey white xii mary in the unreasoning agony of her grief blamed shelley for the child's death and for time felt toward him an extreme physical antagonism which subsided into apathy and spiritual alienation </s>
<s> mary's black moods made her difficult to live with and shelley himself fell into deep dejection </s>
<s> he expressed his sense of their estrangement in some of the lyrics of all my saddest poems in one fragment of verse for example he lamented that mary had left him in this dreary world alone thy form is here indeed lovely one but thou art fled gone down the dreary road that leads to sorrow's most obscure abode </s>
<s> thou sittest on the hearth of pale despair where for thine own sake cannot follow thee </s>
<s> professor white believed that shelley recorded this estrangement only in veiled terms in julian and maddalo or in poems that he did not show to mary and that mary acknowledged it only after shelley's death in her poem the choice and in her editorial notes on his poems of that year </s>
<s> but this unpublished story written after the death of their other child william certainly contains though also in veiled terms mary's immediate recognition and remorse </s>
<s> mary well knew believe what she was doing to shelley </s>
<s> in an effort to purge her own emotions and to acknowledge her fault she poured out on the pages of mathilda the suffering and the loneliness the bitterness and the self recrimination of the past months </s>
<s> the biographical elements are clear mathilda is certainly mary herself mathilda's father is godwin woodville is an idealized shelley </s>
<s> like mathilda mary was woman of strong passions and affections which she often hid from the world under placid appearance </s>
<s> like mathilda's mary's mother had died few days after giving her birth </s>
<s> like mathilda she spent part of her girlhood in scotland </s>
<s> like mathilda she met and loved poet of exceeding beauty and also like mathilda in that sad year she had treated him ill having become captious and unreasonable in her sorrow </s>
<s> mathilda's loneliness grief and remorse can be paralleled in mary's later journal and in the choice this story was the outlet for her emotions in </s>
<s> woodville the poet is virtually perfect glorious from his youth like an angel with winged feet all beauty all goodness all gentleness </s>
<s> he is also successful as poet his poem written at the age of twenty three having been universally acclaimed </s>
<s> making allowance for mary's exaggeration and wishful thinking we easily recognize shelley woodville has his poetic ideals the charm of his conversation his high moral qualities his sense of dedication and responsibility to those he loved and to all humanity </s>
<s> he is mary's earliest portrait of her husband drawn in year when she was slowly returning to him from the hearth of pale despair the early circumstances and education of godwin and of mathilda's father were different </s>
<s> but they produced similar men each extravagant generous vain dogmatic </s>
<s> there is more of godwin in this tale than the account of great man ruined by character and circumstance </s>
<s> the relationship between father and daughter before it was destroyed by the father's unnatural passion is like that between godwin and mary </s>
<s> she herself called her love for him excessive and romantic xiii she may well have been recording in mathilda's sorrow over her alienation from her father and her loss of him by death her own grief at spiritual separation from godwin through what could only seem to her his cruel lack of sympathy </s>
<s> he had accused her of being cowardly and insincere in her grief over clara's death xiv and later he belittled her loss of william xv he had also called shelley disgraceful and flagrant person because of shelley's refusal to send him more money xvi no wonder if mary felt that like mathilda she had lost beloved but cruel father </s>
<s> thus mary took all the blame for the rift with shelley upon herself and transferred the physical alienation to the break in sympathy with godwin </s>
<s> that she turned these facts into story of incest is undoubtedly due to the interest which she and shelley felt in the subject at this time </s>
<s> they regarded it as dramatic and effective theme </s>
<s> in august of shelley completed the cenci </s>
<s> during its progress he had talked over with mary the arrangement of scenes he had even suggested at the outset that she write the tragedy herself </s>
<s> and about year earlier he had been urging upon her translation of alfieri's myrrha </s>
<s> thomas medwin indeed thought that the story which she was writing in was specifically based on myrrha </s>
<s> that she was thinking of that tragedy while writing mathilda is evident from her effective use of it at one of the crises in the tale </s>
<s> and perhaps she was remembering her own handling of the theme when she wrote the biographical sketch of alfieri for lardner's cabinet cyclopaedia nearly twenty years later </s>
<s> she then spoke of the difficulties inherent in such subject inequality of age adding to the unnatural incest </s>
<s> to shed any interest over such an attachment the dramatist ought to adorn the father with such youthful attributes as would be by no means contrary to probability xvii this she endeavored to do in mathilda aided indeed by the fact that the situation was the reverse of that in myrrha </s>
<s> mathilda's father was young he married before he was twenty </s>
<s> when he returned to mathilda he still showed the ardour and freshness of feeling incident to youth he lived in the past and saw his dead wife reincarnated in his daughter </s>
<s> thus mary attempts to validate the situation and make it by no means contrary to probability mathilda offers good example of mary shelley's methods of revision </s>
<s> study of the manuscript shows that she was careful workman and that in polishing this bizarre story she strove consistently for greater credibility and realism more dramatic if sometimes melodramatic presentation of events better motivation conciseness and exclusion of purple passages </s>
<s> in the revision and rewriting many additions were made so that mathilda is appreciably longer than the fields of fancy </s>
<s> but the additions are usually improvements much fuller account of mathilda's father and mother and of their marriage which makes of them something more than lay figures and to great extent explains the tragedy development of the character of the steward at first merely the servant who accompanies mathilda in her search for her father into the sympathetic confidant whose responses help to dramatise the situation an added word or short phrase that marks mary shelley's penetration into the motives and actions of both mathilda and her father </s>
<s> therefore mathilda does not impress the reader as being longer than the fields of fancy because it better sustains his interest </s>
<s> and with all the additions there are also effective omissions of the obvious of the tautological of the artificially elaborate xviii the finished draft mathilda still shows mary shelley's faults as writer verbosity loose plotting somewhat stereotyped and extravagant characterization </s>
<s> the reader must be tolerant of its heroine's overwhelming lamentations </s>
<s> but she is after all in the great tradition of romantic heroines she compares her own weeping to that of boccaccio's ghismonda over the heart of guiscardo </s>
<s> if the reader can accept mathilda on her own terms he will find not only biographical interest in her story but also intrinsic merits feeling for character and situation and phrasing that is often vigorous and precise </s>

<s> th it is only four o'clock but it is winter and the sun has already set there are no clouds in the clear frosty sky to reflect its slant beams but the air itself is tinged with slight roseate colour which is again reflected on the snow that covers the ground </s>
<s> live in lone cottage on solitary wide heath no voice of life reaches me </s>
<s> see the desolate plain covered with white save few black patches that the noonday sun has made at the top of those sharp pointed hillocks from which the snow sliding as it fell lay thinner than on the plain ground few birds are pecking at the hard ice that covers the pools for the frost has been of long continuance am in strange state of mind am alone quite alone in the world the blight of misfortune has passed over me and withered me know that am about to die and feel happy joyous feel my pulse it beats fast place my thin hand on my cheek it burns there is slight quick spirit within me which is now emitting its last sparks </s>
<s> shall never see the snows of another winter do believe that shall never again feel the vivifying warmth of another summer sun and it is in this persuasion that begin to write my tragic history </s>
<s> perhaps history such as mine had better die with me but feeling that cannot define leads me on and am too weak both in body and mind to resist the slightest impulse </s>
<s> while life was strong within me thought indeed that there was sacred horror in my tale that rendered it unfit for utterance and now about to die pollute its mystic terrors </s>
<s> it is as the wood of the eumenides none but the dying may enter and oedipus is about to die what am writing must collect my thoughts </s>
<s> do not know that any will peruse these pages except you my friend who will receive them at my death </s>
<s> do not address them to you alone because it will give me pleasure to dwell upon our friendship in way that would be needless if you alone read what shall write </s>
<s> shall relate my tale therefore as if wrote for strangers </s>
<s> you have often asked me the cause of my solitary life my tears and above all of my impenetrable and unkind silence </s>
<s> in life dared not in death unveil the mystery </s>
<s> others will toss these pages lightly over to you woodville kind affectionate friend they will be dear the precious memorials of heart broken girl who dying is still warmed by gratitude towards you your tears will fall on the words that record my misfortunes know they will and while have life thank you for your sympathy </s>
<s> but enough of this </s>
<s> will begin my tale it is my last task and hope have strength sufficient to fulfill it </s>
<s> record no crimes my faults may easily be pardoned for they proceeded not from evil motive but from want of judgement and believe few would say that they could by different conduct and superior wisdom have avoided the misfortunes to which am the victim </s>
<s> my fate has been governed by necessity hideous necessity </s>
<s> it required hands stronger than mine stronger do believe than any human force to break the thick adamantine chain that has bound me once breathing nothing but joy ever possessed by warm love delight in goodness to misery only to be ended and now about to be ended in death </s>
<s> but forget myself my tale is yet untold </s>
<s> will pause few moments wipe my dim eyes and endeavour to lose the present obscure but heavy feeling of unhappiness in the more acute emotions of the past was born in england </s>
<s> my father was man of rank he had lost his father early and was educated by weak mother with all the indulgence she thought due to nobleman of wealth </s>
<s> he was sent to eton and afterwards to college allowed from childhood the free use of large sums of money thus enjoying from his earliest youth the independance which boy with these advantages always acquires at public school </s>
<s> under the influence of these circumstances his passions found deep soil wherein they might strike their roots and flourish either as flowers or weeds as was their nature </s>
<s> by being always allowed to act for himself his character became strongly and early marked and exhibited various surface on which quick sighted observer might see the seeds of virtues and of misfortunes </s>
<s> his careless extravagance which made him squander immense sums of money to satisfy passing whims which from their apparent energy he dignified with the name of passions often displayed itself in unbounded generosity </s>
<s> yet while he earnestly occupied himself about the wants of others his own desires were gratified to their fullest extent </s>
<s> he gave his money but none of his own wishes were sacrifised to his gifts he gave his time which he did not value and his affections which he was happy in any manner to have called into action </s>
<s> do not say that if his own desires had been put in competition with those of others that he would have displayed undue selfishness but this trial was never made </s>
<s> he was nurtured in prosperity and attended by all its advantages every one loved him and wished to gratify him </s>
<s> he was ever employed in promoting the pleasures of his companions but their pleasures were his and if he bestowed more attention upon the feelings of others than is usual with schoolboys it was because his social temper could never enjoy itself if every brow was not as free from care as his own </s>
<s> while at school emulation and his own natural abilities made him hold conspicuous rank in the forms among his equals at college he discarded books he believed that he had other lessons to learn than those which they could teach him </s>
<s> he was now to enter into life and he was still young enough to consider study as school boy shackle employed merely to keep the unruly out of mischief but as having no real connexion with life whose wisdom of riding gaming </s>
<s> he considered with far deeper interest so he quickly entered into all college follies although his heart was too well moulded to be contaminated by them it might be light but it was never cold </s>
<s> he was sincere and sympathizing friend but he had met with none who superior or equal to himself could aid him in unfolding his mind or make him seek for fresh stores of thought by exhausting the old ones </s>
<s> he felt himself superior in quickness of judgement to those around him his talents his rank and wealth made him the chief of his party and in that station he rested not only contented but glorying conceiving it to be the only ambition worthy for him to aim at in the world </s>
<s> by strange narrowness of ideas he viewed all the world in connexion only as it was or was not related to his little society </s>
<s> he considered queer and out of fashion all opinions that were exploded by his circle of intimates and he became at the same time dogmatic and yet fearful of not coinciding with the only sentiments he could consider orthodox </s>
<s> to the generality of spectators he appeared careless of censure and with high disdain to throw aside all dependance on public prejudices but at the same time that he strode with triumphant stride over the rest of the world he cowered with self disguised lowliness to his own party and although its chi ef never dared express an opinion or feeling until he was assured that it would meet with the approbation of his companions </s>
<s> yet he had one secret hidden from these dear friends secret he had nurtured from his earliest years and although he loved his fellow collegiates he would not trust it to the delicacy or sympathy of any one among them </s>
<s> he loved </s>
<s> he feared that the intensity of his passion might become the subject of their ridicule and he could not bear that they should blaspheme it by considering that trivial and transitory which he felt was the life of his life </s>
<s> there was gentleman of small fortune who lived near his family mansion who had three lovely daughters </s>
<s> the eldest was far the most beautiful but her beauty was only an addition to her other qualities her understanding was clear strong and her disposition angelically gentle </s>
<s> she and my father had been playmates from infancy diana even in her childhood had been favourite with his mother this partiality encreased with the years of this beautiful and lively girl and thus during his school college vacations they were perpetually together </s>
<s> novels and all the various methods by which youth in civilized life are led to knowledge of the existence of passions before they really feel them had produced strong effect on him who was so peculiarly susceptible of every impression </s>
<s> at eleven years of age diana was his favourite playmate but he already talked the language of love </s>
<s> although she was elder than he by nearly two years the nature of her education made her more childish at least in the knowledge and expression of feeling she received his warm protestations with innocence and returned them unknowing of what they meant </s>
<s> she had read no novels and associated only with her younger sisters what could she know of the difference between love and friendship </s>
<s> and when the development of her understanding disclosed the true nature of this intercourse to her her affections were already engaged to her friend and all she feared was lest other attractions and fickleness might make him break his infant vows </s>
<s> but they became every day more ardent and tender </s>
<s> it was passion that had grown with his growth it had become entwined with every faculty and every sentiment and only to be lost with life </s>
<s> none knew of their love except their own two hearts yet although in all things else and even in this he dreaded the censure of his companions for thus truly loving one inferior to him in fortune nothing was ever able for moment to shake his purpose of uniting himself to her as soon as he could muster courage sufficient to meet those difficulties he was determined to surmount </s>
<s> diana was fully worthy of his deepest affection </s>
<s> there were few who could boast of so pure heart and so much real humbleness of soul joined to firm reliance on her own integrity and belief in that of others </s>
<s> she had from her birth lived retired life </s>
<s> she had lost her mother when very young but her father had devoted himself to the care of her education he had many peculiar ideas which influenced the system he had adopted with regard to her she was well acquainted with the heroes of greece and rome or with those of england who had lived some hundred years ago while she was nearly ignorant of the passing events of the day she had read few authors who had written during at least the last fifty years but her reading with this exception was very extensive </s>
<s> thus although she appeared to be less initiated in the mysteries of life and society than he her knowledge was of deeper kind and laid on firmer foundations and if even her beauty and sweetness had not fascinated him her understanding would ever have held his in thrall </s>
<s> he looked up to her as his guide and such was his adoration that he delighted to augment to his own mind the sense of inferiority with which she sometimes impressed him when he was nineteen his mother died </s>
<s> he left college on this event and shaking off for while his old friends he retired to the neighbourhood of his diana and received all his consolation from her sweet voice and dearer caresses </s>
<s> this short seperation from his companions gave him courage to assert his independance </s>
<s> he had feeling that however they might express ridicule of his intended marriage they would not dare display it when it had taken place therefore seeking the consent of his guardian which with some difficulty he obtained and of the father of his mistress which was more easily given without acquainting any one else of his intention by the time he had attained his twentieth birthday he had become the husband of diana </s>
<s> he loved her with passion and her tenderness had charm for him that would not permit him to think of aught but her </s>
<s> he invited some of his college friends to see him but their frivolity disgusted him </s>
<s> diana had torn the veil which had before kept him in his boyhood he was become man and he was surprised how he could ever have joined in the cant words and ideas of his fellow collegiates or how for moment he had feared the censure of such as these </s>
<s> he discarded his old friendships not from fickleness but because they were indeed unworthy of him </s>
<s> diana filled up all his heart he felt as if by his union with her he had received new and better soul </s>
<s> she was his monitress as he learned what were the true ends of life </s>
<s> it was through her beloved lessons that he cast off his old pursuits and gradually formed himself to become one among his fellow men distinguished member of society patriot and an enlightened lover of truth and virtue he loved her for her beauty and for her amiable disposition but he seemed to love her more for what he considered her superior wisdom </s>
<s> they studied they rode together they were never seperate and seldom admitted third to their society </s>
<s> thus my father born in affluence and always prosperous clombe without the difficulty and various disappointments that all human beings seem destined to encounter to the very topmost pinacle of happiness around him was sunshine and clouds whose shapes of beauty made the prospect divine concealed from him the barren reality which lay hidden below them </s>
<s> from this dizzy point he was dashed at once as he unawares congratulated himself on his felicity </s>
<s> fifteen months after their marriage was born and my mother died few days after my birth </s>
<s> sister of my father was with him at this period </s>
<s> she was nearly fifteen years older than he and was the offspring of former marriage of his father </s>
<s> when the latter died this sister was taken by her maternal relations they had seldom seen one another and were quite unlike in disposition </s>
<s> this aunt to whose care was afterwards consigned has often related to me the effect that this catastrophe had on my father's strong and susceptible character </s>
<s> from the moment of my mother's death untill his departure she never heard him utter single word buried in the deepest melancholy he took no notice of any one often for hours his eyes streamed tears or more fearful gloom overpowered him </s>
<s> all outward things seemed to have lost their existence relatively to him and only one circumstance could in any degree recall him from his motionless and mute despair he would never see me </s>
<s> he seemed insensible to the presence of any one else but if as trial to awaken his sensibility my aunt brought me into the room he would instantly rush out with every symptom of fury and distraction </s>
<s> at the end of month he suddenly quitted his house and unatteneded sic by any servant departed from that part of the country without by word or writing informing any one of his intentions </s>
<s> my aunt was only relieved of her anxiety concerning his fate by letter from him dated hamburgh </s>
<s> how often have wept over that letter which untill was sixteen was the only relick had to remind me of my parents </s>
<s> pardon me it said for the uneasiness have unavoidably given you but while in that unhappy island where every thing breathes her spirit whom have lost for ever spell held me </s>
<s> it is broken have quitted england for many years perhaps for ever </s>
<s> but to convince you that selfish feeling does not entirely engross me shall remain in this town untill you have made by letter every arrangement that you judge necessary </s>
<s> when leave this place do not expect to hear from me must break all ties that at present exist </s>
<s> shall become wanderer miserable outcast alone </s>
<s> alone in another part of the letter he mentioned me as for that unhappy little being whom could not see and hardly dare mention leave her under your protection </s>
<s> take care of her and cherish her one day may claim her at your hands but futurity is dark make the present happy to her my father remained three months at hamburgh when he quitted it he changed his name my aunt could never discover that which he adopted and only by faint hints could conjecture that he had taken the road of germany and hungary to turkey thus this towering spirit who had excited interest and high expectation in all who knew and could value him became at once as it were extinct </s>
<s> he existed from this moment for himself only </s>
<s> his friends remembered him as brilliant vision which would never again return to them </s>
<s> the memory of what he had been faded away as years passed and he who before had been as part of themselves and of their hopes was now no longer counted among the living </s>
<s> chapter ii now come to my own story </s>
<s> during the early part of my life there is little to relate and will be brief but must be allowed to dwell little on the years of my childhood that it may be apparent how when one hope failed all life was to be blank and how when the only affection was permitted to cherish was blasted my existence was extinguished with it </s>
<s> have said that my aunt was very unlike my father </s>
<s> believe that without the slightest tinge of bad heart she had the coldest that ever filled human breast it was totally incapable of any affection </s>
<s> she took me under her protection because she considered it her duty but she had too long lived alone and undisturbed by the noise and prattle of children to allow that should disturb her quiet </s>
<s> she had never been married and for the last five years had lived perfectly alone on an estate that had descended to her through her mother on the shores of loch lomond in scotland </s>
<s> my father had expressed wish in his letters that she should reside with me at his family mansion which was situated in beautiful country near richmond in yorkshire </s>
<s> she would not consent to this proposition but as soon as she had arranged the affairs which her brother's departure had caused to fall to her care she quitted england and took me with her to her scotch estate </s>
<s> the care of me while baby and afterwards untill had reached my eighth year devolved on servant of my mother's who had accompanied us in our retirement for that purpose </s>
<s> was placed in remote part of the house and only saw my aunt at stated hours </s>
<s> these occurred twice day once about noon she came to my nursery and once after her dinner was taken to her </s>
<s> she never caressed me and seemed all the time staid in the room to fear that should annoy her by some childish freak </s>
<s> my good nurse always schooled me with the greatest care before she ventured into the parlour and the awe my aunt's cold looks and few constrained words inspired was so great that seldom disgraced her lessons or was betrayed from the exemplary stillness which was taught to observe during these short visits under my good nurse's care ran wild about our park and the neighbouring fields </s>
<s> the offspring of the deepest love displayed from my earliest years the greatest sensibility of disposition </s>
<s> cannot say with what passion loved every thing even the inanimate objects that surrounded me </s>
<s> believe that bore an individual attachment to every tree in our park every animal that inhabited it knew me and loved them </s>
<s> their occasional deaths filled my infant heart with anguish </s>
<s> cannot number the birds that have saved during the long and severe winters of that climate or the hares and rabbits that have defended from the attacks of our dogs or have nursed when accidentally wounded </s>
<s> when was seven years of age my nurse left me </s>
<s> now forget the cause of her departure if indeed ever knew it </s>
<s> she returned to england and the bitter tears she shed at parting were the last saw flow for love of me for many years </s>
<s> my grief was terrible had no friend but her in the whole world </s>
<s> by degrees became reconciled to solitude but no one supplied her place in my affections </s>
<s> lived in desolate country where there were none to praise and very few to love it is true that now saw little more of my aunt but she was in every way an unsocial being and to timid child she was as plant beneath thick covering of ice should cut my hands in endeavouring to get at it </s>
<s> so was entirely thrown upon my own resourses </s>
<s> the neighbouring minister was engaged to give me lessons in reading writing and french but he was without family and his manners even to me were always perfectly characteristic of the profession in the exercise of whose functions he chiefly shone that of schoolmaster </s>
<s> sometimes strove to form friendships with the most attractive of the girls who inhabited the neighbouring village but believe should never have succeeded even had not my aunt interposed her authority to prevent all intercourse between me and the peasantry for she was fearful lest should acquire the scotch accent and dialect little of it had although great pains was taken that my tongue should not disgrace my english origin </s>
<s> as grew older my liberty encreased with my desires and my wanderings extended from our park to the neighbouring country </s>
<s> our house was situated on the shores of the lake and the lawn came down to the water's edge </s>
<s> rambled amidst the wild scenery of this lovely country and became complete mountaineer passed hours on the steep brow of mountain that overhung waterfall or rowed myself in little skiff to some one of the islands </s>
